level.heading: Definitions.
level.text: For the purposes of this chapter, the term:
"Commission" means the Motor Vehicle Theft Prevention Commission established by § 3-1352.
"Fund" means the General Fund of the District of Columbia.
"Motor vehicle" shall have the same meaning as provided in § 50-1501.01(1).

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 19-21 substituted "General Fund of the District of Columbia" for "Motor Vehicle Theft Prevention Fund established by § 3-1356".

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 17-197
level.text: Law 17-197, the "Motor Vehicle Theft Prevention Act of 2008", was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 17-138 which was referred to the Committee on Public Safety and Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on April 1, 2008, and May 6, 2008, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on May 23, 2008, it was assigned Act No. 17-394 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 17-197 became effective on July 18, 2008.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 19-21
level.text: For history of Law 19-21, see notes under § 3-101.01.

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Section 7093 of D.C. Law 17-219 repealed section 11 of D.C. Law 17-197.
